title: How to Make Oat Breakfast Bars

steps.headline: Line the baking tray with paper.
Mix the oats, coconut, seeds, and dried fruit in a bowl.
Warm the syrup in a small saucepan.
steps.description: Stir in the butter of choice.

steps.headline: Pour the warmed mixture into the oat mixture and stir through thoroughly.
Place the mixture into the baking tray and press down onto the tray and spread across to the edges.
Place in the oven and bake for 35–40 minutes, until lightly golden.
Remove from the heat and place the tray on a cooling rack for 20 minutes.
Slide the slice out while still a little warm and cut into slices/bars.

tyn: Baking tray, 24 centimeter (9.4 in) x 30 centimeter (11.8 in)
Slide to help move the slice out of the tray
text: Preheat the oven to 140ºC.  Line the baking tray with paper.  Mix the oats, coconut, seeds, and dried fruit in a bowl. Combine thoroughly. Warm the syrup in a small saucepan. Stir in the butter of choice. Pour the warmed mixture into the oat mixture and stir through thoroughly.  Place the mixture into the baking tray and press down onto the tray and spread across to the edges.  Place in the oven and bake for 35–40 minutes, until lightly golden.  Remove from the heat and place the tray on a cooling rack for 20 minutes.  Slide the slice out while still a little warm and cut into slices/bars. These will harden upon cooling. Finished.
sentences: Line the baking tray with paper.
Mix the oats, coconut, seeds, and dried fruit in a bowl.
Warm the syrup in a small saucepan.
Stir in the butter of choice.
Pour the warmed mixture into the oat mixture and stir through thoroughly.
Place the mixture into the baking tray and press down onto the tray and spread across to the edges.
Place in the oven and bake for 35–40 minutes, until lightly golden.
Remove from the heat and place the tray on a cooling rack for 20 minutes.
Slide the slice out while still a little warm and cut into slices/bars.
